publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2197 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles-That the Parliament notes the recent constructive proposals by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles to Greece in advance of the Olympic Games to be held there in 2004, which involve putting aside the issue of ownership and instead entering into a partnership to ensure that the marbles are displayed and conserved in the best possible way; further notes that the Greek Government is willing to enter a rolling loan agreement so that other artefacts of great significance which have never before been seen in the UK can be displayed in the British Museum; regrets that Her Majesty's Government has not yet responded to these positive proposals, and hopes that Her Majesty's Government will at last recognise the justice of the Greek case and will help the Greek Government to mark the return of the Olympics to their nation with a cultural gesture of world significance.
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Alex Neil*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Donald Gorrie*

S1M-2197 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles—That the Parliament notes the recent constructive proposals by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles to Greece in advance of the Olympic Games to be held there in 2004, which involve putting aside the issue of ownership and instead entering into a partnership to ensure that the marbles are displayed and conserved in the best possible way; further notes that the Greek Government is willing to enter a rolling loan agreement so that other artefacts of great significance which have never before been seen in the UK can be displayed in the British Museum; regrets that Her Majesty’s Government has not yet responded to these positive proposals, and hopes that Her Majesty’s Government will at last recognise the justice of the Greek case and will help the Greek Government to mark the return of the Olympics to their nation with a cultural gesture of world significance. Supported by: Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Irene McGugan*, Mr Keith Raffan*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Tricia Marwick*

S1M-2197 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles-That the Parliament notes the recent constructive proposals by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles to Greece in advance of the Olympic Games to be held there in 2004, which involve putting aside the issue of ownership and instead entering into a partnership to ensure that the marbles are displayed and conserved in the best possible way; further notes that the Greek Government is willing to enter a rolling loan agreement so that other artefacts of great significance which have never before been seen in the UK can be displayed in the British Museum; regrets that Her Majesty's Government has not yet responded to these positive proposals, and hopes that Her Majesty's Government will at last recognise the justice of the Greek case and will help the Greek Government to mark the return of the Olympics to their nation with a cultural gesture of world significance. Supported by: Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Ms Sandra White, Irene McGugan, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Mr Mike Rumbles*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-2197 Michael Russell: Parthenon Marbles-That the Parliament notes the recent constructive proposals by the Greek Government for the return of the Parthenon Marbles to Greece in advance of the Olympic Games to be held there in 2004, which involve putting aside the issue of ownership and instead entering into a partnership to ensure that the marbles are displayed and conserved in the best possible way; further notes that the Greek Government is willing to enter a rolling loan agreement so that other artefacts of great significance which have never before been seen in the UK can be displayed in the British Museum; regrets that Her Majesty's Government has not yet responded to these positive proposals, and hopes that Her Majesty's Government will at last recognise the justice of the Greek case and will help the Greek Government to mark the return of the Olympics to their nation with a cultural gesture of world significance. Supported by: Alex Neil, Donald Gorrie, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Ms Sandra White, Irene McGugan, Mr Keith Raffan, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Mr Mike Rumbles, Nora Radcliffe, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Linda Fabiani*
S1M-2197 Parthenon Marbles (lodged on 10 September 2001) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
